title: Egyptian authorities detain engineer over deadly train crash
description: An engineer has been detained following a Tuesday train crash in Qalyub, Egypt, that killed four people after slamming into a concrete barrier.

title: Louisiana high school brawl results in multiple students arrested, officer injured
description: A brawl at a high school in East Baton Rouge, Louisiana resulted in 10 students being arrested and at least one police officer injured.

title: Calvin Ridley writes heartfelt letter after NFL reinstatement: 'I made the worst mistake of my life'
description: After being reinstated by the NFL following his season-long suspension, Calvin Ridley owned his actions and expressed excitement as he begins a new chapter in his career.

title: Oklahoma homeowner charged with murder after setting fire to building that occupants refused to leave: police
description: An Oklahoma homeowner and his friend are facing murder charges for allegedly setting fire to a building after the occupants refused to leave, according to police.

title: Denise Austin, 66, flaunts toned abs in bikini top and shorts
description: Denise Austin looked toned in a recent photo she shared on her Instagram while standing among wildflowers in a blue bikini top with black bicycle shorts.

title: House Republicans planning to visit Jan. 6 defendants in DC jail
description: House Republicans, led by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, are planning to visit Jan. 6 defendants being held at the Washington, D.C. jail.

title: Police name suspect in Albuquerque double homicide
description: Police have named a suspect in an Albuquerque double homicide in late February. The man was accused of stabbing his ex-girlfriend and her boyfriend many times before shooting himself.

title: Virginia 6-year-old who shot teacher won't face charges but others could: Prosecutor
description: The city prosecutor in Newport News, Virginia, said Wednesday that he would not seek charges against the 6-year-old boy who shot his 2nd grade teacher, Abby Zwerner.

title: UCLA loses starting guard for March Madness with Achilles injury: reports
description: The UCLA Bruins will be heading into March Madness without one of their key starters, guard Jaylen Clark, who suffered a torn Achilles during the team's regular-season finale.

title: Brazil's Lula uses Women's Day to tout new spending plans
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva announced Wednesday that his administration would seek to promote spending on women's healthcare and other gender-specific interests.

title: Joy Reid goes on another tear against Florida governor: 'If it ain't White, it ain't right in DeSantistan'
description: MSNBC host Joy Reid once again blasted Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis after he opened the latest Florida legislature session on Tuesday previewing upcoming bills.

title: Kristin Cavallari reveals why she will never use Botox
description: Kristin Cavallari explains she will never get Botox because she believes in a more natural approach to aging, saying her wrinkles don't bother her.

title: Aid group briefly shuts down hospital in Haiti amid spike in gang violence
description: Doctors Without Borders was forced to briefly shut down a hospital in Haiti amid a spike in violence. Another nearby hospital said they have seen a tenfold increase in gunshot wounds.

title: NFL legend Michael Irvin denies alleged misconduct by hotel employee in first public remarks: ‘Sickens me’
description: Dallas Cowboys star and Hall of Fame wideout Michael Irvin made his first public remarks Wednesday since he was accused of inappropriate misconduct by a hotel employee last month.

title: Fauci, allies' COVID theory approach 'antithetical to science,' ex-CDC chief says after snub comes to light
description: Robert Redfield, former head of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, joined 'The Story' on Fox News to sound off on the prospect he was left out of important calls

title: Tiger Woods' ex Erica Herman claims in lawsuit she was tricked to leave home and subsequently locked out
description: An October lawsuit filed by Tiger Woods' ex-girlfriend claimed she was tricked into leaving her Florida residence and was eventually locked out of the home.

title: Jessica Simpson shares cozy photos with 'lover' Eric Johnson
description: Jessica Simpson is sharing cozy snaps of her weekend getaway with her husband of nine years, Eric Johnson, and the couple's friends. Simpson and Johnson share three children.

title: House Dems vote against bill to permanently classify fentanyl as Schedule 1 controlled substance
description: House Democrats on Wednesday voted against a bill that could permanently classify fentanyl and fentanyl analogues as Schedule 1 substances.

title: NFL owners might be colluding against Lamar Jackson, but not because he’s Black -- commentary
description: Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson was franchise-tagged on Tuesday ahead of the deadline but the lack of suitors for him has some calling foul.

title: Grizzlies’ Ja Morant avoids criminal charges after appearing to flash gun in video
description: Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant will not face any criminal charges after appearing to display a gun at a nightclub in a video early Saturday morning.

title: The Mexican government is not willing to do anything serious to the cartels: Bill Barr
description: Former Attorney General Bill Barr urges officials to stop the Mexican cartels following the kidnapping of four Americans on “The Story with Martha MacCallum.”

title: DHS removed just 409 of 345,000 unaccompanied child migrants since FY 2021
description: DHS removed just over 400 unaccompanied minors of over 345,000 encountered at the border since October 2020, according to new data obtained via a lawsuit this week.

title: Politico's banned word list revealed: Shows outlet urged writers to avoid terms ‘mankind’, ‘biological male'
description: Reports confirmed Politico provided a lengthy banned word list to its journalists to ensure they were inclusive enough in their coverage.

title: Chicago fireman's wife, children hospitalized after housefire
description: The wife and three young children of a Chicago firefighter were critically injured after their northwest side home caught fire while he was on duty.

title: 'Ted Lasso' star Jason Sudeikis opens up about co-parenting with ex Olivia Wilde amid nanny-gate drama
description: Comedian Jason Sudeikis opened up about co-parenting with "Don't Worry Darling" director and ex Olivia Wilde during the "Ted Lasso" season 3 premiere.

title: Biden admin quietly delays major oil, gas leasing decision
description: The Biden administration stated in a court filing Monday night that it won't issue a key offshore oil and gas leasing plan until December at the earliest.

title: Legendary college basketball coach Jim Boeheim retires
description: Jim Boeheim has called it a career after spending 47 years as Syracuse's head coach. He went 1,015–440 coaching the Orange, winning the 2003 National Championship.

title: US issues 'do not travel' warning for parts of Mexico as spring break approaches
description: The U.S. State Department renewed a warning for travelers heading to Mexico, saying some states are a Level 4: Do Not Travel, including Tamaulipas, where Matamoros is located.

title: Security forces deploy tear gas, disperse Hamas militant's West Bank funeral
description: Security forces fired tear gas canisters and flash grenades at mourners of Hamas militant Abdul Fattah Kharushah after they began protesting the Palestinian Authority.

title: New York teacher called class 'little sexist children' for playing with kids of the same sex: former student
description: A former student of a Long Island teacher claimed she once called his entire class “sexist little children” because they were only playing with classmates of the same sex.

title: Top Homeland Republican says Americans' kidnapping in Mexico shows cartels 'emboldened' under Biden admin
description: The House Homeland Security Committee chair is taking aim at the Biden administration in the wake of the deaths of two Americans after four were attacked and kidnapped by cartels.

title: Alabama's Brandon Miller breaks silence on deadly shooting, 'Lock him up' chants
description: For the first time since it was revealed he transported the murder weapon used in the death of a woman in January, Brandon Miller spoke to the media.

title: Randi Weingarten claims children ‘do better in schools under teachers unions’
description: American Federation of Teachers President Randi Weingarten wrote an op-ed for The Daily Beast to make "a factual case for teachers’ unions" that students perform better under their provision.

title: Alabama oil rig catches fire along Mobile River
description: A "multi-story, oil rig-like structure" caught fire along the east side of the Mobile River in Alabama on Wednesday afternoon, according to Mobile Fire-Rescue.

title: Daughter sues Rochester, New York facility over disabled mother's rape
description: Magdalena Cruz alleges she was conceived when an employee at a New York care facility raped her severely mentally handicapped mother in the 1980s.

title: Daniel Jones reveals massive Giants extension came mere minutes before deadline: 'It was exciting'
description: Daniel Jones was in the New York Giants' building when his agent came to him just minutes before the franchise tag deadline with the last offer. He said yes.

title: Josh Hart dismisses notion fatigue played role in Knicks loss, says some work ‘12-hour shifts’ for perspective
description: New York Knicks guard Josh Hart refused to say that fatigue played a factor in Tuesday's loss to the Charlotte Hornets, pointing to those who work 12-hour shifts for perspective.

title: 4,500 Georgia soldiers deploying to bolster European allies
description: 4,500 Georgia soldiers are deploying this summer to train with NATO allies as a part of troop buildup. The soldiers will be deployed for an estimated nine months.

title: Nine boxes of Biden documents were taken from Boston office
description: The National Archives disclosed in a response letter to Sen. Ron Johnson this week that nine boxes of documents were picked up in President Biden's lawyer's Boston office.

title: Yellowstone National Park spots first grizzly bear to emerge from hibernation this year
description: A Yellowstone National Park biologist spotted the first grizzly bear to emerge from hibernation in 2023, finding the 300-pound animal hunting for food near a bison carcass.

title: Loaded gun confiscated from 'Hangover' star Mike Epps at Indiana airport
description: Federal agents reportedly confiscated a loaded gun from actor Mike Epps' hand luggage at Indianapolis International Airport on Sunday morning.

title: NBA legend Shaq weighs in on controversy surrounding Ja Morant: 'You're not a rapper'
description: Morant has stepped away from the Grizzlies after he appeared to brandish a gun on Instagram Live last weekend. O'Neal believes Morant’s behavior could lead to serious consequences.

title: Kansas City gun dealer to pay $150K settlement in 2020 lawsuit
description: A gun dealer accused of contributing to surging violence by selling illegal firearms has agreed to pay $150,000 to Kansas City in order to settle the lawsuit.

title: Two 'Cop City' domestic terror suspects linked to left-wing legal group that shields Antifa
description: Two individuals arrested on domestic terrorism charges for their roles in the "Cop City" attack in Georgia have ties to the National Lawyers Guild, a group that has defended Antifa.

title: Mexican pageant challenges standard of beauty
description: A Mexican pageant challenges the standard of beauty in a competition that celebrates the beauty and talent of women from the lower-class neighborhoods of Veracruz.

title: Seahawks’ Pete Carroll ‘fired up’ over Geno Smith contract, says Seattle could still draft quarterback
description: Geno Smith capped off a phenomenal season with the Seahawks with a massive three-year deal, but coach Pete Carroll isn’t ruling out the chance that Seattle could still draft a QB.

title: Former NYT editor calls out Dr. Fauci over 'seriously' mishandling COVID-19 origin theories

title: Protester arrested as demonstrators confront police at DC statehood rally ahead of Senate vote on crime bill
description: Demonstrators gathered outside the U.S. Senate in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday to protest ahead of the vote that is expected to overturn city legislation.

title: Murdaugh boat crash victim Mallory Beach's family seeks 'accountability' in summer trial
description: Deceased 19-year-old Mallory Beach's family is seeking "accountability" in their upcoming trial in Hampton County, South Carolina. Beach was killed in an accident on the Murdaugh family's boat in 2019.

title: Iowa Republican unveils legislation to protect rural land from China, other foreign adversaries
description: A GOP member of the House Agriculture Committee introduced legislation Wednesday that would prohibit Chinese investors from making rural land purchases in the U.S.

title: Feds suspect Tesla that hit firetruck in fatal California crash was on Autopilot
description: A Tesla was operating on an automated driving system when it crashed into a firetruck in California last month, killing the driver and critically injuring a passenger.

title: US sanctions Iranian officials over women's rights abuses
description: The United States is imposing more sanctions on Iranian officials over women's rights abuses. Nationwide anti-government protests started Sept. 16 over the treatment of young women.

title: Georgia chief justice says lawyer shortage slows down courts
description: Georgia's chief justice says a shortage of lawyers is slowing down the legal docket. Due to the pandemic Georgia's courts are working to resolve a backlog of cases.

title: Children's author, 'Olivia' creator Ian Falconer dead at 63
description: Children's author Ian Falconer, creator and author of the "Olivia" series, died of natural causes Tuesday at his Norwalk, Connecticut, home. He was 63.

description: Fairfax County Public Schools’ TJ Partnership Fund has reportedly received more than $1 million in donations from multiple Chinese-backed groups.

title: West Virginia train derailment injures 3, rockslide causes fiery diesel fuel and oil spill
description: A train derailment in West Virginia left three people injured and caused a fire because of a diesel fuel and oil spill on Wednesday morning.

description: Podcaster and comedian Joe Rogan opened his own venue bucking modern cancel culture norms, warning audiences, "certain comedians are not for everybody."

title: California county claps back following report of 'spy operation' on church that resisted COVID mandates
description: A California county facing a lawsuit from a local church over its COVID restrictions is clapping back as news of its reported surveillance of the house of worship gains publicity.

title: Alaskan lawmakers reject pay hikes for state governor, top leaders
description: Alaskan lawmakers rejected a proposal that would raise pay for the state's governor and top leaders. Officials suggested the increase due to salaries not keeping up with inflation.

title: King Charles’ coronation oil won’t include intestinal wax of sperm whales, civet secretions
description: King Charles III has chosen a vegan holy oil for his coronation in May. Queen Elizabeth II's holy oil was made from musk deer, civet cat and sperm whale.

title: Pennsylvania Legislature sees spending bump, record surplus
description: The Pennsylvania Legislature's spending, including legislators' and staffers' salaries, increased last year, as did its overall surplus, according to a report.

title: Texas elementary school principal arrested after bringing cocaine to school: reports
description: A Texas elementary school assistant principal is charged with bringing cocaine to campus after an employee found the drugs in a restroom at the school.

title: Georgia gunman fires shots outside elementary school, manhunt underway: police
description: Georgia police are asking for help in identifying a suspected gunman who fire shots near a school.

description: Sarm Heslop, a United Kingdom native who was living in the US Virgin Islands with her American boyfriend Ryan Bane, has now been missing for two years.

description: Two GOP senators voted to advance embattled former LA Mayor Eric Garcetti despite his possible knowledge and enablement of sexual harassment in his former office

description: Three people have been injured in a West Virginia train derailment on Wednesday. Authorities say the fiery crash was caused by a rockslide along the tracks.

title: GOP-led bill would slap sanctions on foreign govs with risky biological programs after lab leak findings
description: The bill would impose sanctions on foreign nations that have biological and chemical programs operating with "gross negligence" following the FBI's admission on COVID origins.

title: Man serving life sentence admits to 1990 Missouri slaying
description: A man who is serving time admitted to one of four deaths he was linked to in a 1990 Missouri slaying. The man was given a life sentence after pleading guilty to first-degree murder.

description: Fox News' Benjamin Hall, who was severely injured while covering Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, is doing just fine – as long as he’s with his wife and three daughters.

title: Florida kitten who was rescued from sky-high power pole is now searching for a home

title: Kayleigh McEnany fact-checks Karine Jean-Pierre's claim that fentanyl is at 'historic lows'

description: New York Bodega & Small Business Association president says it's "wrong" for Adams to force store owners to confront potential criminals on showing their faces.

title: LA fire burns though top floor of government office building

title: Feds drop probe into Puerto Rico zoo where various species died before getting transferred to US sanctuary
description: The investigation in Puerto Rico’s lone zoo where various animals died has been dropped. The remaining animals will be transferred to sanctuaries in the U.S. mainland.

description: Fox News Digital received a leaked letter sent by Sen. Josh Hawley to Sen. Gary Peters regarding whistleblower allegations of abuse by President Biden's nominee for U.S. Archivist.

title: Idaho murders suspect Bryan Kohberger was busted in PJs, stuffing trash in Ziploc bags, prosecutor says
description: Bryan Kohberger was allegedly awake at 1:30 a.m., bagging up his "personal trash" and wearing gloves when police burst in and arrested him on Dec. 30.

description: The Georgia Senate has approved a measure that would give low-income pregnant women cash. The measure will now head to Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp for his signature.

title: Military vet convicted of storming the US Capitol

title: World Health Organization fires top Western Pacific official after he was accused of racist, abusive behavior

description: Filmmaker Steven Spielberg warned about the 'terrifying' implications of letting artificial intelligence or robots create art without human control.

description: The Mack MD Electric is the brand's first all-electric medium duty truck. It will be offered in five straight-job lengths with ranges of up to 230 miles per charge.

description: Tony DeAngelo is living up to his reputation in Philadelphia after getting ejected from a game on Tuesday night for spearing Tampa Bay Lightning forward Corey Perry in the groin.

description: Sen. John Kennedy, R-La., dissected Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's response to questioning during a Senate committee hearing on 'The Faulkner Focus.'

description: FOX Business host Kennedy discussed edits to R.L. Stine's classic children's book series 'Goosebumps' and how sensitivity culture continues to alter other franchises.

description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle announced that their daughter had been christened in a private ceremony in California, publicly calling her a princess.

description: House members in Delaware approved a bill legalizing recreational marijuana once again after several years of previous failed attempts.

description: A proposal for a community police oversight board in Vermont was rejected by voters. The board would have the authority to discipline Burlington police officers.

description: Lawmaker Matt Fariss, who represented part of Virginia for over a decade, has been charged in an alleged hit-an-run. He is accused of maliciously injuring a woman.

title: AL Gov. Ivey proposes a $400 rebate per taxpayer from state’s pandemic relief funds
description: Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey has called an anticipated special session to address the state’s remaining pandemic relief funds by proposing a one-time tax rebate.

description: Madonna seemingly confirmed her romance with rumored boyfriend Josh Popper by sharing a photo of the two kissing on social media. Popper is 35 years younger than the singer.

title: AL legislative session to address budgets, COVID funds, race and gender lessons in schools
description: Alabama’s 2023 legislative session has begun. Lawmakers will focus on key issues such as pandemic relief funds, budget surplus, and certain race and gender lessons taught in schools.

title: Minnesota judge hit by car, dies while out for run on Florida vacation: report
description: St. Louis County Judge Sally L. Tarnowski was widely mourned following her death in Florida Monday, as reports cite family claiming she was out running and was fatally struck by a car.

title: Mayorkas gushes over border agents as possible impeachment proceedings loom
description: Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro Mayorkas spoke highly of Border Patrol agents under his command at the League of United Latin American Citizens conference.

title: Four men charged with stealing over $1 million of product from Microsoft cargo trucks: California AG Rob Bonta
description: Four men have been charged with stealing over $1 million worth of good from cargo trucks leaving Microsoft facilities across several California counties, the state AG announced.

title: Wall collapse at New York City demolition site kills 1, injures 3 others
description: An accident at a New York City demolition site killed one person and injured three others. A wall at the demolition site collapsed causing a man to be buried in rubble.

title: Americans who survived Mexico kidnapping shaken after they 'watched' others die: family
description: Families of the two surviving Americans identified them during interviews with local news outlets, detailing the relief they felt and the horror their loved ones experienced.

description: A state prison for men in Concord, New Hampshire, will have help from 18 state National Guard soldiers and airmen to help corrections officials with staff shortages.

description: The Diocese of Wilmington condemned a proposed bill in the Delaware General Assembly that critics say would force priests to violate canon law by breaking the seal of confession.

title: Indian army training goes awry when fired mortar shell falls short of target, kills 3 in nearby village
description: A mortar shell misfired during an army training session in India. The shell fell short of its target and killed three people in a nearby village instead.

title: Michelle Yeoh deletes Instagram post about 'non-White Best Actress winner' after intense backlash
description: Michelle Yeoh may have violated Oscar rules for a since-deleted Instagram post criticizing the Oscars and naming her direct competition Cate Blanchett.

description: A House Republican on Wednesday took to the House floor and called for the resignation of Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg after a series of crises.

title: Second hiker collapses, dies on trail at Big Bend National Park in Texas in matter of weeks
description: The 64-year-old woman was the second hiker to collapse and die while hiking a trail at Big Bend National Park in Texas since Feb. 18, when a 56-year-old man died.

title: The Salvation Army offers emotional, spiritual support after Ohio train derailment: 'Providing hope'
description: Cptn. Angelica Spence, commanding corps officer at The Salvation Army in Salem, Ohio, shared how the group is meeting the needs of over 7,000 people impacted by the East Palestine, Ohio, disaster.

title: Grizzlies star Ja Morant could face suspension over gun drama
description: Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant could face a suspension if the NBA determined he broke league bylaws over the gun incident from last weekend.

title: Playing with LeBron James ‘a gift and a curse,’ former teammate says
description: Former teammate J.R. Smith said playing alongside LeBron James is a "gift and a curse" due to the scrutiny that comes with being on his team.

title: Texas bill proposes tax credits for nondivorced, traditional married couples
description: Legislation was proposed in Texas that that would give tax credits to qualifying families with four or more children; however, not everyone agrees with rule for qualification.

title: TikTok launches project to convince West it's not spying for China
description: Chinese social media app TikTok is continuing its campaign to ease regulators' concerns about data collection, expanding its offensive to Europe.

title: Pennsylvania school graffiti threatens 5 White teachers' lives unless 'more Black’ staff hired
description: Graffiti warning an Upper Darby, Pennsylvania, school to hire "more Black teachers or 5 white ones will die" was found scrawled on a bathroom wall, igniting outrage from parents.

title: Former Capitol Police chief says officials' concerns about 'optics' led to Jan. 6 security failures
description: Former Capitol Police Chief Steven Sund said his requests for federal assistance on January 6 were initially denied by a Pelosi appointee due to "optics."

title: CNN's Jill Biden primetime special flops, sheds nearly half of network's time slot average

description: A North Carolina legislation designed to help hotels evict longer-term guests violating establishment rules have been approved. The bill will now head to Gov. Roy Cooper.

description: Bruce Willis' wife, Emma Heming Willis, is advocating for the actor following his dementia diagnosis. The "Die Hard" star retired from acting in March 2022.

title: WA sells organizations allowances to emit greenhouse gas, auction raises $300M
description: Washington held its first auction selling allowances to emit greenhouse gas. Businesses, lawmakers, and individuals bought 6.2 million allowances, raising a revenue of $300 million.

title: Thai man sentenced to 2 years for selling calendars that allegedly mocked the country's monarch
description: Narathorn Chotmankongsin, a man from Thailand, was sentenced to two years in prison for selling calendars that mocked the country's monarch

title: Civil rights groups outraged after Gigi Sohn withdraws FCC nomination: ‘Sad, shoddy, and shameful’
description: President Biden's choice for an open FCC seat, Gigi Sohn, withdrew her nomination on Tuesday while citing "unrelenting, dishonest and cruel attacks" during the confirmation process.

description: Longtime "Wheel of Fortune" host Pat Sajak had an awkward exchange with a contestant from Florida that grabbed the attention of fans and viewers.

title: DNI Haines deems Chinese Communist Party ‘leading and most consequential threat to US national security’
description: DNI Avril Haines, in testifying before the Senate Intelligence Committee on "worldwide threats," said the CCP is the "most consequential threat to U.S. national security."

description: Dr. Anthony Fauci addressed his past clashes with Republicans during an interview Tuesday and claimed he has been totally "transparent" and "honest" throughout his career.

title: Squatters take over Chicago woman's home as she tries to sell, claim they've been scammed themselves: report

title: Canadian woman found dead at Mexican resort, boyfriend in custody: 'We want to know what happened'
description: A Canadian woman was found dead at a Mexican resort only one day after she arrived with her boyfriend for vacation in Playa del Carmen

title: Saints' Tyrann Mathieu reacts to Ravens using franchise tag on Lamar Jackson: 'Feel some kind of way about it'
description: If Lamar Jackson plays under the non-exclusive tag, he will earn $32.416 million in 2023, but if he does sign with another team, the Ravens receive two first-round picks as compensation.

title: Christine Taylor discusses Ben Stiller split after 17-year marriage and how they 'found' their way back
description: Christine Taylor is sharing how she and Ben Stiller rekindled their romance during the coronavirus pandemic. The couple wed in 2000, split in 2017 and share two children.

title: One of two American victims who survived Mexico kidnapping talks to mom from hospital, is 'doing ok': report
description: One of the Americans kidnapped during an ambush by a Mexican drug cartel last week was reportedly able to talk to her mother from a Texas hospital on Tuesday.

title: Man who set himself on fire at University of California-Berkeley dies
description: A man who set himself on fire on the University of California, Berkeley campus has died, according to media reports.

title: U.S. to loosen COVID restrictions for travelers coming from China: reports
description: U.S. officials speaking on anonymity said covid-19 restrictions on travelers coming from China to the U.S. will be relaxed by the end of the week.

title: Massachusetts auditor to review Legislature for first time since 1922
description: Democratic Massachusetts Auditor Diana DiZoglio on Tuesday announced a plan to conduct the first audit of the state's Legislature in over a century.

title: Trump impeachment witness Alexander Vindman accused of trying to profit off Ukraine war with defense contracts
description: Former Trump impeachment witness Alexander Vindman is being accused of trying to profit off the Ukraine war with lucrative defense contracts through his private company.

title: Tester rails against 'multi-millionaires' in re-election bid launch, but disclosures reveal his own wealth
description: Democratic Montana Sen. Jon Tester railed against "multi-millionaires" during his campaign kickoff speech, despite federal filings showing he's a millionaire himself.

title: New Minnesota law allows driver's licenses for illegal immigrants
description: Democratic Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz signed off on a legislative proposal to allow more than 80,000 non-U.S. citizens to receive driver's licenses.

title: Comedians defend Chris Rock over backlash to Will Smith, Jada Pinkett jokes
description: Comedians like D.L. Hughley and Leslie Jones defended Chris Rock against critics who said he was unfair to Will Smith and Jada Pinkett in his Netflix stand-up special.

title: Federal Trade Commission demands Elon Musk 'identify all journalists' who had access to Twitter Files
description: The Biden administration's Federal Trade Commission is under fire for demanding information from Twitter, including a list of journalists who had access to internal files.

title: Retired QB Philip Rivers speaks on possible NFL comeback: 'I think it's done'
description: Rivers said although he did hear from a couple NFL teams prior to the playoffs, he did not contact anyone. The 41-year-old seems to have closed the door on his career.

title: Illinois court orders retrial for convicted child murderer tortured into confession
description: An Illinois appeals court has ordered a retrial for George Anderson, who in 1991 admitted to killing two minors while being beaten by an alleged "midnight crew" of rogue detectives.

title: Mike Greenberg says he may cut his pinky toe off if Aaron Rodgers joins Jets
description: ESPN's Mike Greenberg really wants Aaron Rodgers to join his New York Jets to be their quarterback, and he is willing to go to extremes to make that happen.

title: Charles Barkley rips Kendrick Perkins for suggesting racial bias plays role in MVP voting
description: Basketball Hall of Famer Charles Barkley ripped Kendrick Perkins' remarks suggesting there was racial bias when it came to NBA MVP voting.

title: Seven-figure ad campaign exposes billions in Biden's Medicare cuts after accusations GOP wants to slash
description: A conservative advocacy organization is pushing back against President Biden's proposed cuts to Medicare Advantage with a seven-figure ad campaign in 14 vulnerable Dem districts.

title: 16 New Jersey homes endangered as fire rips through state's southern Pinelands
description: A wind-whipped fire in New Jersey's Pinelands put 16 homes at risk as firefighters tried to contain the 125-acre Tuesday afternoon blaze.

title: Pennsylvania House sets May special election date for vacant GOP seat
description: The Pennsylvania House of Representatives has set a special election for May 16 to replace former Republican Rep. Lynda Schlegel Culver.

title: Wisconsin Gov. Evers likely to veto budget unless it includes certain pay hikes
description: Democratic Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers said Tuesday that he would consider vetoing any Republican budget plan without significant pay increases for prosecutors and corrections officers.

title: Oklahoma non-binary Democrat censured for harboring fugitive in state capitol office
description: An Oklahoma state legislator was censured on Tuesday for harboring a person wanted for questioning after allegedly assaulting a trooper and house representative last week.

title: Bindi Irwin reveals she underwent surgery for endometriosis after suffering 'insurmountable' pain for 10 years
description: Bindi Irwin, daughter of the late Steve Irwin, shared that she has been struggling with endometriosis for the past decade and recently underwent surgery to treat the condition.

title: DeSantis shoots down media claims he supports 'blogger bill': 'Not anything that I've ever supported'
description: Gov. Ron DeSantis, R-Fla., pushed back against mainstream media framing him as a supporter of Florida bill that would require bloggers to register with the state.

title: Southwest Airlines brawl breaks out on Dallas to Phoenix flight: 'That's why I beat your a--'
description: A shocking video from a Southwest Airlines flight shows a man aggressively punching another man after claiming that the man bumped into his wife and spoke aggressively to his family.

title: Connecticut sues 4 firearms companies in ghost gun crackdown
description: Connecticut is suing four firearms companies in a ghost gun crackdown. The four companies were accused of mailing illegal parts with no serial numbers to an undercover investigator.

title: Mississippi opal gains status as state symbol under new law
description: The Mississippi opal has gained status as the state's gemstone under a new law. The measure received unanimous support from lawmakers in the state House and Senate.

title: Northern California storm eases but more snow expected
description: Northern California's winter storm has slowed down but the state is expecting more snow through the midweek. Forecasters said part of the mountain range is under an avalanche warning.

title: Judge grants bond for Southern Poverty Law Center attorney charged in Atlanta 'Cop City' domestic terrorism
description: Southern Poverty Law Center employee and barred attorney Thomas Webb Jurgens, charged with domestic terrorism in the attack on Atlanta's "Cop City," was granted $5,000 bond Tuesday.

title: California man dies after tumbling down coastal Oregon cliff
description: A California man died Saturday after tumbling down a coastal Oregon cliff. The man was hiking beyond a safety fence when he slipped, and was swept into the ocean.

title: Texas legislation would protect minors from sexually explicit content, allows parents to sue
description: A Texas lawmaker proposed legislation that would shield kids from sexually explicit content online by requiring age verification and allowing parents to sue porn websites.
